title: 2002 Jeep Grand Cherokee Overland V8 HO 4×4 at No Reserve
description: This 2002 Jeep Grand Cherokee Overland has remained registered in California from new and is finished in Inferno Red Tinted Pearl Coat over Light Slate Gray Preferred Suede and leather. The truck is powered by a 4.7-liter V8 linked with a four-speed automatic transmission and a Quadra-Drive II NV247 dual-range transfer case. Features include black-finished 17" wheels, a lift kit, a sunroof, an aftermarket roof rack, fog lights, auxiliary lights, power-adjustable side mirrors, keyless entry, power windows, an aftermarket CB radio, and an AM/FM/CD/cassette stereo. This WJ Grand Cherokee has 141k miles and is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with the owner's manual and a clean California title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a No Reserve: 2002 Jeep Grand Cherokee Overland V8 HO 4×4 at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #191,579.
text: This 2002 Jeep Grand Cherokee Overland has remained registered in California from new and is finished in Inferno Red Tinted Pearl Coat over Light Slate Gray Preferred Suede and leather. The truck is powered by a 4.7-liter V8 linked with a four-speed automatic transmission and a Quadra-Drive II NV247 dual-range transfer case. Features include black-finished 17″ wheels, a lift kit, a sunroof, an aftermarket roof rack, fog lights, auxiliary lights, power-adjustable side mirrors, keyless entry, power windows, an aftermarket CB radio, and an AM/FM/CD/cassette stereo. This WJ Grand Cherokee has 141k miles and is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with the owner’s manual and a clean California title. The truck is finished in Inferno Red Tinted Pearl Coat (EL) and features a sunroof, bright grille trim, a rear window wiper, an aftermarket roof rack that is fitted with auxiliary lights, fog lights, power-adjustable side mirrors, a receiver hitch, and a liftgate. A June 2006 entry in the Carfax report notes that the vehicle was involved in a rear-end collision, though no other details are available. The black-finished 17″ wheels were sourced from a later-model Jeep and are mounted with Firestone Destination tires. The truck has been modified with a lift kit, and braking is provided by anti-lock discs at each corner. The seating surfaces are upholstered in Light Slate Gray Preferred Suede and leather, and interior appointments include keyless entry, power locks and windows, dual-zone automatic climate control, and an AM/FM/CD/cassette stereo. An aftermarket CB radio is installed. The leather- and wood-trimmed steering wheel frames is mounted on a tilting column and frames a 125-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, and auxiliary gauges for voltage, fuel level, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 141k miles. The high-output 4.7-liter Power Tech V8 was factory rated at 265 horsepower and 325 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission and a Quadra-Drive II NV247 dual-range transfer case. The truck is equipped with Vari-Lok front and rear differentials. The Carfax report shows the aforementioned accident report. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. Your real-time updates could not be connected. html:
This 2002 Jeep Grand Cherokee Overland has remained registered in California from new and is finished in Inferno Red Tinted Pearl Coat over Light Slate Gray Preferred Suede and leather. The truck is powered by a 4.7-liter V8 linked with a four-speed automatic transmission and a Quadra-Drive II NV247 dual-range transfer case. Features include black-finished 17″ wheels, a lift kit, a sunroof, an aftermarket roof rack, fog lights, auxiliary lights, power-adjustable side mirrors, keyless entry, power windows, an aftermarket CB radio, and an AM/FM/CD/cassette stereo. This WJ Grand Cherokee has 141k miles and is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with the owner’s manual and a clean California title.

The truck is finished in Inferno Red Tinted Pearl Coat (EL) and features a sunroof, bright grille trim, a rear window wiper, an aftermarket roof rack that is fitted with auxiliary lights, fog lights, power-adjustable side mirrors, a receiver hitch, and a liftgate. A June 2006 entry in the Carfax report notes that the vehicle was involved in a rear-end collision, though no other details are available.

The black-finished 17″ wheels were sourced from a later-model Jeep and are mounted with Firestone Destination tires. The truck has been modified with a lift kit, and braking is provided by anti-lock discs at each corner.

The seating surfaces are upholstered in Light Slate Gray Preferred Suede and leather, and interior appointments include keyless entry, power locks and windows, dual-zone automatic climate control, and an AM/FM/CD/cassette stereo. An aftermarket CB radio is installed.

The leather- and wood-trimmed steering wheel frames is mounted on a tilting column and frames a 125-mph speedometer, a 7k-rpm tachometer, and auxiliary gauges for voltage, fuel level, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 141k miles.

The high-output 4.7-liter Power Tech V8 was factory rated at 265 horsepower and 325 lb-ft of torque.

Power is sent to all four wheels through a four-speed automatic transmission and a Quadra-Drive II NV247 dual-range transfer case. The truck is equipped with Vari-Lok front and rear differentials.

The Carfax report shows the aforementioned accident report.
